DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Decision Imaging Procedure Lesion Follow Up Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator response as to whether there is a clinical judgment to follow the lesion by a method of imaging.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Decision Imaging Technique Lesion Follow-up
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration._Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.:Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.
Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.

Property.preferredDefinition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.:The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Data Not Available Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, not applicable, or that the data is not present in the original source.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes, No, or Unknown Response Source Data Not Available Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.:Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.
Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
